item.title: Gus, don't be a silly goose
item.description: Beneath the sunny veneer of “Psych,” a darker shade lurks in one of the first examples of a common comedic bit throughout the series. When Gus, burdened by the whirlwind of psychic detective life, confesses his burnout, Shawn’s apparent empathy quickly curdles into deception. With a chirpy “don’t be a silly goose,” he seems to reinforce their friendship and bond with a promise of unconditional assistance. This seemingly innocuous phrase becomes a Trojan horse, masking a web of manipulative tactics.
